full_summary:
**MFD Maintenance & Consumables Service for ISC & CIRNAC (Konica Minolta C554e Devices)**

### Overview
Indigenous Services Canada (ISC) and Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada (CIRNAC) have a requirement for consumables and maintenance services for their 126 Konica Minolta C554e multifunction devices located in the National Capital Region (NCR).

### Contract Scope
This contract is for on-site hardware maintenance, support services, and consumables on a cost-per-impression basis for the 126 Konica Minolta MFDs located in ISC and CIRNAC offices in the NCR. The contract requires a total of one (1) year initial service, with one (1) year option, which must meet the mandatory technical requirements detailed in Annex A.

### Service Requirements
The successful service provider must:

- Provide on-site maintenance and support services for the Konica Minolta C554e devices
- Deliver consumables on a cost-per-impression basis
- Meet the mandatory technical requirements outlined in Annex A
- Comply with all relevant laws, regulations, and policies

### Contact and Procurement Information
For more information about this solicitation, please contact Katherine Ikeson at [katherine.ikeson@ssc-spc.gc.ca](mailto:katherine.ikeson@ssc-spc.gc.ca) or 613-298-2147.

**Regions of Opportunity**: World (Global)
**Regions of Delivery**: National Capital Region (NCR)
**Procurement Category**: SRVTGD
**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
**Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
**Contracting Entity**: Shared Services Canada
**Trade Agreements**: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
              Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
              Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
              Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
              Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement

**Tender Closing Date**: August 23, 2022, 2:00 pm (Eastern Standard Time)

Note:  The bidder can access the attachments by following the link provided.
